abstract.0: Enhance the security of your Oracle HCM, ERP, and other SaaS solutions with Oracle Identity Cloud Service. In this session hear how customers are using Oracle Identity Cloud Service to add advanced security to their SaaS solutions including multifactor authentication, adaptive security, custom password policies, custom login screen branding, and advanced auditing. Join us to learn the basics of adding Oracle Identity Cloud Service to an Oracle SaaS solution and further utilizing Oracle Identity Cloud Service advanced capabilities to enhance your solutions.
abstract.1: Oracle Data Integration Platform Cloud allows you to stream transactional data into big data systems in real time and perform stream analysis to initiate automated actions through the use of rules, patterns, and machine learning. In this lab learn how to seamlessly capture database transactions using Oracle GoldenGate for Big Data and replicate them into Kafka topics. Then use Oracle Stream Analytics to analyze these event streams by enriching them with contextual data, detecting geospatial patterns, and applying machine learning.
abstract.2: In this session learn how to use the MySQL Document Store, primarily using Python but other languages are covered as well.
abstract.3: With the growing number of data breaches every day and the stringent regulatory landscape, safeguarding sensitive information has become critical. As part of Oracle’s defense in depth strategy, database assessments help identify areas of risk and recommends changes to mitigate configuration, operational, and technical risks. Attend this hands-on lab and learn how to easily identify your exposure to the top database security risks and how to remediate them. Discover how to analyze the risk findings identified within the security reports and prioritize them so that you are well on your path to securing your databases.
abstract.4: In this hands-on lab learn how to train an audio recognition model using Oracle Data Science Cloud. See how to access interactive tools, connect to data sources, and train a deep learning model to recognize different spoken words. Then deploy this model as an API so that it can be easily shared and integrated into different workflows and services.
abstract.5: Big data projects require blazing fast network performance, powerful compute, and vastly scalable storage, all on demand. In this hands-on-lab get an introduction to a Cloudera Hadoop deployment, operations, and benchmarking on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.
abstract.6: Enterprises are moving various types of data into data lakes, increasing data complexity exponentially. In this session learn how to enable users to experience instant query response across the vast and varied data in their data lake. Applications such as Oracle Analytics Cloud; Oracle Business Intelligence Suite, Enterprise Edition; Tableau; and custom executive dashboards all connect to Sparkline and consume data in seconds. See how to leverage Spark and create Sparkline and in-memory modern OLAP cubes/indexes for data analytics at scale.
abstract.7: This session explores Corosync and Pacemaker concepts with demonstrations using Oracle VM VirtualBox and multiple Oracle Linux guest virtual machines. Installation, cluster configuration, and testing are covered, including an Oracle VM VirtualBox fencing agent.
abstract.8: In this session learn the basics of Oracle Content and Experience Cloud by creating a new digital asset repository and then managing images, content types, content items, and translations. Then use those assets in an enterprise microsite built directly inside of Oracle Content and Experience Cloud. This session is appropriate for anyone considering Oracle Content and Experience Cloud to manage digital assets or to build, deploy, and monitor web experiences.
abstract.9: In this session learn about brand new tools and capabilities in Oracle Content and Experience Cloud that make it fast and easy to build single-page applications using the popular React JS library and ecosystem. Learn to install Oracle Content and Experience Cloud command line tools and build a React application with content fed from Oracle Content and Experience Cloud APIs, making it possible for business users to update the site. This session is appropriate for developers considering building modern web applications with Oracle Content and Experience Cloud as a headless content management system. No prior React or Oracle Content and Experience Cloud knowledge is required.
abstract.10: In this session learn to develop and deploy a RESTful service using Oracle SQL Developer, Oracle REST Data Services, and Oracle Database. Then connect these services as data sources to different Oracle JavaScript Extension Toolkit visualization components to quickly build rich HTML5 applications using a free and open source JavaScript framework.
abstract.11: In this session learn about the latest features of Oracle Data Provider for .NET (ODP.NET) and Oracle Database's tight integration with Visual Studio. This lab covers topics including using .NET core and Oracle Database with ODP.NET core, getting started with .NET and Oracle, using NuGet to install and configure ODP.NET, entity framework, fully managed ODP.NET, ODP.NET best practices for performance, PL/SQL debugging with Visual Studio, ASP.NET web application development, Oracle Performance Analyzer and SQL Tuning Advisor in Visual Studio, and more. Choose whichever topic interests you and work at your own pace. Suitable for all levels of experience, including those new to .NET and Oracle and experienced users.
abstract.12: In this hands-on lab learn the basics of Oracle Self-Service Integration Cloud Service including how to browse public recipes, cloud applications, and recipe job activity. See firsthand the simplicity of an integration solution addressing application user needs without the complexities of traditional integration middleware solutions. Walk through consuming public recipes, creating your own connecting productivity tools, using Oracle SaaS Applications, and creating your own simple custom cloud apps.
abstract.13: The size and scale of high-performance computing (HPC) can seem daunting. Customers typically talk thousands and hundreds of thousands of cores. The applications that run on HPC are also very specific to a particular type of problem. In this hands-on lab, utilize common templates to deploy a small HPC cluster and run OpenFOAM, a computational fluid dynamics simulation application. The application will calculate drag and downforce on a popular motorcycle. At the conclusion of the lab see how a GPU could be utilized to visualize the model after the simulation. New compute and networking hardware are also discussed.
abstract.14: In this lab learn how to use Vagrant to automatically deploy an Oracle Container for use with a Kubernetes cluster on Oracle Linux 7 virtual machines using Oracle VM VirtualBox. Once the cluster is deployed, learn how to deploy a MySQL Cluster as a Kubernetes pod and then leverage the MySQL operator for Kubernetes to automatically deploy and configure additional database containers.
abstract.15: Are you challenged with increasing user adoption for your Oracle applications? Oracle Digital Assistant Cloud is here to assist. In this session learn how it can enable your users to access critical data and services using natural language, and perform critical tasks on your behalf.  Based on Oracle Intelligent Bots, Oracle Digital Assistant Cloud is the one central point where app users can access any SaaS application skills, such as completing a HR request, creating an expense report, and so on. In this session configure your first digital assistant and experience this exciting new way your users can access Oracle apps.
abstract.16: Oracle Blockchain Cloud Service provides a platform to provision Blockchain networks and enables real-time transactions to securely share tamper-proof data across a multiparty business network. In this hands-on session see how Blockchain can bring transparency and accountability to a complex supply chain and enable real-time tracking of assets. Discover a multiparty Blockchain consortia implemented using Oracle Blockchain Cloud Service and learn to operate within a multiorganization network by assuming the role of one of the organizations. Go through the app interfaces and smart contracts and execute transactions in real time to move/track assets, while interacting with fellow lab participants on the business network.
abstract.17: One of the marquee features of Oracle Application Express 18.1 is the improved ability to consume external REST services and REST-enabled SQL. In this session learn how to reference external REST services as web source modules and how to create reports, charts, calendars, or other components using these. Remote Oracle Databases can be accessed as REST-enabled SQL services as well; learn to create an Oracle Application Express component driven by an SQL query and have it executed on a remote Oracle Database over a REST interface using HTTPS and JSON.
abstract.18: In order for your company to compete in the digital landscape, APIs must become a cornerstone of your digital foundation. In this hands-on lab see how quickly you can design new APIs in a collaborative fashion with Oracle Apiary Cloud Service. Get firsthand experience testing mock APIs and then moving your design to the API platform where you can apply security and flow control policies, and deploy to the gateway of your choice—all from a web console. Discover how easy it is to publish that API to a developer portal and get application users to register to use the API, and see how to monitor the usage of the API and how APIs can be quickly published from Oracle Integration Cloud.
abstract.19: Chatbots are one of the first widespread uses of artificial intelligence and natural language processing. They enable end users to interact with data or a service in the most natural way possible: through natural languages and a conversational UI. In this hands-on lab explore this new technology that is set to transform the way we interact with enterprise services. Develop and train a chatbot by defining intents, utterances, and entities, and then design the conversation flow, connect the chatbot to a back-end APIs, and expose the chatbot in Facebook Messenger. Attendees must have a Facebook account to participate.
abstract.20: In this session discover Oracle NoSQL Database Cloud and learn how easy it is to provision tables and indices, and insert, update, read, and delete data. See how to modify the table to increase or decrease the throughput and storage capacity, and learn how to estimate throughput and storage requirements for your workloads.
abstract.21: In this session get a practical introduction to the MySQL X DevAPI and the MySQL Document Store for NodeJS developers.
abstract.22: In this hands-on-lab experience the complete development cycle for the cloud, from initial planning through managing code versions, and all the way to continuous delivery—all in a team-enabling platform in the cloud.
abstract.23: Enhance the security of your Oracle Cloud Infrastructure with Oracle CASB Cloud Service. In this session learn how to use Oracle CASB Cloud Service to assess and maintain the configuration of Oracle Cloud Infrastructure with controls monitoring, smart policies, automated user entity behavioral analytics, and integrations with your remediation processes. Join us to jumpstart your expertise in securing the movement to the cloud.
abstract.24: Chatbots and digital assistants enable end user to interact with systems/data with natural language, but in many cases a simple conversational interaction is not enough. Often chatbots have to collect user data that is better suited to a form-based UI.  Or you may want to expose a set of questions and answers and FAQs to your end users without having to go through tedious training of your bots.  And if a bot cannot meet user needs, there should be an option to hand off the entire conversation to a live agent. In this hands-on lab learn to enhance a chatbot with instant apps to enrich user experiences, provide Q&A/FAQs without writing any code, and enable live agent chat integration and conversation hand off.
abstract.25: In this session learn how to enhance the process and connectivity capabilities of your CX applications with Oracle Integration Cloud.  Discover how to create new processes and forms and connect them to your existing CX applications while providing business insight by collecting and collating business metrics from your processes and integrations and presenting them to your business owners and executives.
abstract.26: In this session learn how to add processes to your applications and synchronize data with other applications. Create a forms-driven process to extend an existing applications, discover how to synchronize data by integrating with other applications, and learn how to collect business metrics from your processes and integrations and collate it into a dashboard that can be presented to your business owners and executives. This session explores the power of having a single integrated solution for process integration and real-time dashboards delivered by Oracle Integration Cloud.
abstract.27: In today’s fast-paced business world, moving data as quickly as possible is vital to many business decisions. In this session learn how Oracle GoldenGate is key to moving data rapidly. Discover how Oracle GoldenGate has been enhanced for faster deployments using microservices and explore the new directory structure and how to rapidly deploy a complete unidirectional configuration using microservices. Explore the new Oracle GoldenGate microservices architecture, see how microservices are used with Oracle GoldenGate, and build a unidirectional replication environment using microservices.
abstract.28: The W3C Web Component specification has been adopted as the basis for Oracle JavaScript Extension Toolkit’s composite component architecture (CCA). Via CCA, you can create reusable components such as calendars and task lists that can be reused throughout your application, team, and organization. Component-based development enhances productivity and enables you to implement standards and style guidelines in a common manner. Join this hands-on lab to get experience with CCA in Oracle JavaScript Extension Toolkit. Get step-by-step instructions and learn to create and share components quickly and effectively.
abstract.29: Virtualization is one of the cornerstones of current dynamic data center environments. Oracle Solaris virtualization, security, and compliance tools deliver isolation that has minimal impact on your application performance and delivers maximum security and compliance. In this hands-on lab learn how to use the latest features of Oracle Solaris. Walk through how to completely lock down your containers with Immutable Zones, how to run a compliance report, and how to customize the benchmark to fit your needs. See how you can gather these reports in a central location and look for trends across systems and over time so you can meet your auditor's requirements.
abstract.30: For any organization with a web application, it's critical to optimize performance and communication at the edge. In this hands-on lab learn how to set up and configure Oracle Cloud Infrastructure DNS and Oracle Traffic Director.
abstract.31: Looking for a database platform that is simple, reliable, and affordable? Look no further than Oracle Database Appliance, a purpose-built x86/Linux database platform engineered for ease-of-use.  In this hands-on lab get access to a simulated Oracle Database Appliance environment where you can provision the system, create and delete databases, configure backups, and more. Discover the ease-of-use capabilities of Oracle Database Appliance, and see how simple it is to manage your database estate with both a full web-based GUI and (for those of you love scripting) a full-featured CLI.
abstract.32: Oracle Database In-Memory introduces a new columnar format and a new set of SQL execution optimizations including SIMD processing, column elimination, storage indexes, and in-memory aggregation, all of which are designed specifically for the new columnar format. In this lab get a step-by-step guide on how to get started with Oracle Database In-Memory, learn how to identify which of the optimizations are being used, and see how your SQL statements benefit from them. Learn about the new features available in the latest release and experience firsthand just how easy it is to start taking advantage of this technology and its performance improvements.
abstract.33: This is your opportunity to get up close and personal with Oracle Multitenant. In this session learn about a very broad range of Oracle Multitenant functionality in considerable depth. Warning: This lab has been filled to capacity quickly at every Oracle OpenWorld that it has been offered. It is strongly recommended that you sign up early. Even if you're only able to get on the waitlist, it's always worth showing up just in case there's a no-show and you can grab an available seat.
abstract.34: In this lab learn to write an asynchronous servlet using Servlet 3.0 and ADBA (the proposed async database access standard). You can deploy your servlet and run it in parallel with everyone else in the lab.
abstract.35: In this hands-on lab learn to upgrade to Oracle Database 18c and then convert it to a pluggable database (PDB) and plug it into a multitenant container database (CDB). Attendees also migrate a second 11.2.0.4 database directly into an Oracle Database 18c PDB using the  Full Transportable Export/Import feature. This is a great way to get hands-on experience with different upgrade and migration methods, all under the tutelage of Oracle’s database upgrade team. If time permits, the session also explores several optional areas such as unplug/plug/upgrade, fallback scenarios, working with SQL plan management, and more.
abstract.36: Software in Silicon accelerates and secures Oracle Database and other software running on Oracle's SPARC and Oracle SuperCluster systems to unprecedented levels. This technical, hands-on session explains and demonstrates features of Oracle Database that are accelerated by the Data Analytics Accelerator and encryption technology. The session also demonstrates how to apply this technology to custom-developed software, and the use of Oracle developer tools to analyze performance issues. Finally, get engineering insight into how to increase software quality and how to provide a safer execution environment for software by means of Silicon Secured Memory.
abstract.37: Oracle Java Cloud Service provides a fully managed Oracle WebLogic Server environment in the cloud that secures and automates several lifecycle operations including provisioning, patching, backups, and restore. In the latest release Oracle Java Cloud Service includes the ability to elastically change the shape of the cluster under the load through an autoscaling capability. In this session learn how to set up that feature and see a simulation of the load to verify the behavior of Oracle WebLogic cluster inside Oracle Java Cloud Service.
abstract.38:
Terraform is a widely used open-source provisioning tool for infrastructure in public clouds. It enables you to deploy in minutes all sorts of objects in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (users, groups, virtual cloud networks and related objects, IPsec VPN connections, compute instances, block volumes, database systems, load balancers, and more.) In this hands-on lab see how to easily install and configure Terraform for Oracle Cloud Infrastructure on Oracle Linux 7, and then use it to provision infrastructure in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.

Please create an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure account (https://cloud.oracle.com) before attending in order to carry out the hands-on lab.
abstract.39: In this hands-on lab learn to use the market-leading iPaaS platform, Oracle Integration Cloud, to integrate ERP and/or HCM to other applications for popular business use cases. Bring your integration stories to share with other attendees and hear from Oracle Product Development on these integration patterns in enterprises. Whether you are an ERP/HCM/SaaS analyst or an experienced hands-on integration specialist, learn how the powerful yet simple Oracle Integration Cloud flexes to your integration needs. Come and try for yourself the power-packed ERP and HCM adapters along with advanced orchestration, mapping, transformation, and monitoring capabilities that Oracle Integration Cloud brings you.
abstract.40: The rapid adoption of enterprise cloud-based solutions brings with it a new set of challenges. Data integration remains one of the greatest challenges of any enterprise cloud-based solution. Join this hands-on lab to gain firsthand experience with the power and simplicity of Oracle Data Integration Platform Cloud powered by Oracle Data Integrator, Oracle Enterprise Data Quality solutions, and Oracle GoldenGate. See how Oracle Data Integration Platform Cloud simplifies the end-to-end creation and execution of the historically arduous data integration tasks of ingesting, loading, preparing, and transforming data as well as performing a real-time synchronization between an on-premises and a cloud database in just a few clicks.
abstract.41: In this session learn about the lifecycle of Java EE applications running in Oracle WebLogic Server deployed as container to a Kubernetes infrastructure. With a focus on how kubectl tooling interacts with pods and containers during DevOps operations, see the lifecycle of a demo app in Oracle WebLogic Server running within a managed Kubernetes service in Oracle Cloud.
abstract.42: Oracle Application Express is a low-code development platform that enables you to build stunning, scalable, secure apps with world-class features that can be deployed anywhere. In this lab learn how to convert a spreadsheet into a multiuser, web-based, responsive Oracle Application Express application in minutes—no prior experience with Oracle Application Express is needed. See how to rapidly prototype a data model and then create and deploy a feature-rich responsive application against this data model in minutes. Learn how you can use Oracle Application Express to solve many of your business problems that are going unsolved today.
abstract.43: The real application of machine learning is sometimes difficult to see. In this session create and deploy a common machine learning framework, Tensor Flow, and interact with a fully built machine learning model. Deploy a GPU machine, pull an NVIDIA GPU cloud image, and run an image through the inferencing engine. Make sure to have a digital image ready to test.
abstract.44: Tired of maintaining old DBA scripts that tune Oracle Databases? Are database performance problems getting you down? If so, attend this hands-on lab that guides you to modern methodologies that detect, diagnose problems, and tune database performance in Oracle Database 18c. In this lab learn how to optimize your database performance with the most up-to-date recommendations, and how to make risk-free changes that improve system performance while maintaining stability and reliability.
abstract.45: Do you run Oracle E-Business Suite applications on-premises or in the cloud and want to monitor availability and performance? In this session learn how Oracle Management Cloud enables you to  gain visibility across the entire application environment, from end user through the application tier and down to the database to quickly identify problems and diagnose the root cause. Learn how advanced machine learning technology can be leveraged to simplify the security, monitoring, and management of Oracle E-Business Suite.
abstract.46: As more workloads move to the cloud and autonomous PaaS, and as DevOps practices speed up software development cycles, monitoring for availability and performance becomes more and more challenging. Come to this hands-on lab to see how Oracle Management Cloud's unified platform leverages machine learning to understand application topologies and dependencies as they change, and perform early detection of health and performance issues, all at the speed of DevOps.
abstract.47: MySQL’s InnoDB cluster provides a high-level, easy-to-use solution for MySQL high availability. Combining MySQL Group Replication with MySQL Router and the MySQL Shell into an integrated solution, InnoDB clusters offer easy setup and management of MySQL instances into a fault-tolerant database service. In this session learn how to set up a basic InnoDB cluster, integrate it with applications, and recognize and react to common failure scenarios that would otherwise lead to a database outage.
abstract.48: Whether you're patching a few, hundreds, or thousands of databases, long downtimes and multiple maintenance windows can cause pain for DBAs and application owners. Ease the suffering and improve the quality of life for DBAs using Oracle Enterprise Manager Fleet Maintenance. In this hands-on-lab learn how customers are solving the challenges of patching databases across the enterprise while avoiding excessive downtime and multiple maintenance windows. The Fleet Maintenance feature of Oracle Enterprise Manager enables administrators to patch and upgrade database software with minimal downtime, across the entire database estate, significantly reducing the time required for maintenance activities.
abstract.49: Need a low-latency, high-throughout, scaleout, shared-nothing, highly available, simple-to-use database? Want a SQL interface with real ACID transactions? In this session discover the production version of the next-generation in-memory RDBMS, Oracle TimesTen Scaleout. In this session attendees install from a ZIP file; use both the command line and Oracle SQL Developer to monitor and manage Oracle TimesTen Scaleout; learn how to create tables where the data is distributed via consistent hash, reference, and duplicate; use SQL to access data from any node and do joins over any columns; and dynamically add nodes to Oracle TimesTen Scaleout. Take the opportunity to get an overview of this new product and ask the experts.
abstract.50: This session introduces DTrace to Oracle Linux users and provides a demonstration of DTrace capabilities for introspecting system behavior for performance analysis and debugging.
abstract.51: The rapid adoption of enterprise cloud-based solutions brings with it a new set of challenges.  However, the age-old goal of maximizing value from data does not change. Join this hands-on lab to learn how Oracle Data Integration Platform Cloud powered by Oracle Data Integrator, Oracle Enterprise Data Quality solutions, and Oracle GoldenGate ensures your data solution is built from the ground up on a foundation of best-of-breed data integration, big data integration, data governance, data management, and data automation technologies. Explore the opportunities of developing next-generation operational data stores, enterprise data warehouses, and data marts in cloud using Oracle Data Integration Platform Cloud.
abstract.52: Oracle Application Container Cloud Service is a polyglot runtime for applications developed in one of eight different languages. In this session get a basic introduction to that service and learn how to develop and deploy your first application for Oracle Cloud hosted in Oracle Application Container Cloud Service.
abstract.53:
PLEASE NOTE: YOU MUST BRING YOUR OWN LAPTOP (BYOL) TO PARTICIPATE IN THE HANDS-ON LABS.
Fasten your seatbelts and get in the driver’s seat of Oracle Autonomous Database Cloud. In this session learn to provision, use, and manage the solution while also getting a peek under the hood. This is a hands-on lab and each participant is provided a cloud account but must bring their own laptop.
abstract.54:
PLEASE NOTE: YOU MUST BRING YOUR OWN LAPTOP (BYOL) TO PARTICIPATE IN THE HANDS-ON LABS.
In this hands-on lab discover Oracle Autonomous Data Warehouse Cloud. Create a cloud data warehouse from scratch in minutes. Learn how to quickly and easily design, deploy, and load data into Oracle Autonomous Data Warehouse Cloud, and rapidly create data-driven analytical briefings on both desktop and mobile browsers in Oracle Cloud. See how real-time online scaling capabilities help address ever-changing business requirements in seconds. See the various database monitoring and administration capabilities within Oracle Autonomous Data Warehouse Cloud. Oracle’s perfect quick-start service for fast data loading and sophisticated data reporting and analysis is for everybody.
abstract.55: Oracle Autonomous Data Warehouse Cloud provides an easy-to-use, fully autonomous database that scales elastically, delivers fast query performance, and requires no database administration. In this hands-on-lab walk through deploying an Oracle Autonomous Data Warehouse Cloud database and loading a table using a text file that is stored in object storage.
abstract.56: Transitioning to the cloud and struggling to get complete and centralized visibility to your enterprisewide Oracle Database 12c, Oracle Database 18c, or Oracle Autonomous Database Cloud infrastructure? Need to proactively prevent and diagnose database infrastructure issues, identify systemic database and SQL performance issues, proactively forecast your database resource utilization, and identify Oracle Database security threats and compliance issues? Attend this hands-on lab to learn how you can use Oracle Management Cloud to transform yourself to a cloud database administrator.
abstract.57: Transitioning to the cloud and struggling to get complete and centralized visibility to your enterprisewide Oracle Database 12c, Oracle Database 18c, or Oracle Autonomous Database Cloud infrastructure? Need to proactively prevent and diagnose database infrastructure issues, identify systemic database and SQL performance issues, proactively forecast your database resource utilization, and identify Oracle Database security threats and compliance issues? Attend this hands-on lab to learn how you can use Oracle Management Cloud to transform yourself to a cloud database administrator.
abstract.58: Open source technologies such as Vagrant, Oracle VM VirtualBox, and Oracle Linux can make a real difference when building reliable and reproducible environments. In this lab learn how those technologies help in the automation of the building process for Oracle Database 18c. Learn about the important work Oracle is doing dedicated to those technologies and the automation around Oracle products.
abstract.59: More and more organizations recognize the need to empower business consumers to access data, enrich it, and ask any questions of any data in a truly agile, self-service manner—without involving an expert in the process. In this hands-on lab learn how to use Oracle Data Visualization to quickly uncover key insights through blending, augmenting, and visualizing a variety of data sources. See how easy it is to compose visual stories to better communicate your findings—all without the help of IT.
abstract.60: Come to this hands-on lab to see for yourself how your company can dramatically reduce the time and cost to complete account reconciliations with Oracle EPM Cloud’s financial close solutions.
abstract.61: Join this session to get hands-on experience using Oracle’s new cloud service, Oracle Enterprise Data Management Cloud Service. This session explores the information model, and why Oracle Enterprise Data Management Cloud Service goes beyond just DRM in the cloud. Learn how to register target applications for maintenance through application adapters, how to import metadata and create application views, how to manage metadata with a request, how to export data to a target application, and how to manage security, automate tasks, and perform migrations.
abstract.62: Come to this hands-on lab to see for yourself how your company can dramatically reduce the time and cost to complete a close with Oracle EPM Cloud’s financial close solutions.
abstract.63: Everyone—from casual business consumer to power users—wants to see the signals in their data. Oracle Essbase transforms complex modeling into a simple, straightforward design to forecast results, create sandboxes, and update and visualize the data through Oracle Data Visualization or Excel. In this hands-on lab learn about the power of Oracle Essbase to quickly build custom analytics applications that move beyond silos of data and disconnected spreadsheets, and watch your data come alive.
abstract.64: Oracle Exec Focus is a business guidance application that enables executives and decision-makers to identify and understand metrics that matter most, execute effectively with alignment, collaboration & accountability, and continuously improve the organization’s performance.  Come to this hands-on Lab to understand how Finance executives and their teams can use this content-rich application to monitor the pulse of their organization, collaborate and align on goals, and quickly take actions that lead to the best possible outcomes.
abstract.65: Oracle Exec Focus is a business guidance application that enables executives and decision-makers to identify and understand metrics that matter most; execute effectively with alignment, collaboration, and accountability; and continuously improve the organization’s performance. In this hands-on lab see how HR executives and their teams can use this content-rich application to monitor the pulse of their organization, collaborate and align on goals, and quickly take actions that lead to the best possible outcomes.
abstract.66: Oracle Exec Focus is a business guidance application that enables executives and decision-makers to identify and understand metrics that matter most, execute effectively with alignment, collaboration & accountability, and continuously improve the organization’s performance.  Come to this hands-on Lab to understand how Sales and Customer executives and their teams can use this content-rich application to monitor the pulse of their organization, collaborate and align on goals, and quickly take actions that lead to the best possible outcomes.
abstract.67: Oracle SuperCluster’s virtual assistant leverages an intuitive browser-based interface to manage the lifecycle of I/O domains on Oracle SuperCluster systems. In this session learn how domains can be created, modified, and deleted on demand, allowing CPU, memory, and I/O resources to be allocated as needed to in support of virtual machines that run Oracle Solaris, along with Oracle Database (database domains) or other applications (application domains).
abstract.68: In this session learn how Ksplice lets you apply 100 percent of important security updates without rebooting. Get firsthand experience using Ksplice to manage all the security updates for Kernel, Xen, and userspace packages and libraries while the entire cloud infrastructure is running. See how Ksplice is able to grant zero downtime on hosts, hypervisors, and virtual machines running on top.
abstract.69: Get hands-on and learn the features of the Python cx_Oracle interface for Oracle Database. In this session learn efficient techniques for connection management, statement handling, and more. If you want to use Python and Oracle Database, this session is for you.  Basic programming skills in any language are required.
abstract.70: Data platforms are becoming increasingly complex. Kafka is widely used for real-time stream processing.  Data lakes are persisting massive volumes of historical and unstructured data. Oracle Databases capture the critical information required to run your business. Each data store contains valuable data, yet insights are achieved by correlating queries across these stores. In this session learn how Oracle Big Data SQL easily enables these insights, leveraging your existing investment in applications and skillsets while keeping information safe using Oracle’s advanced security policies.
abstract.71: Unified security monitoring and auditing is critical to detecting modern threats that are rapidly evolving to exploit the growing visibility gaps. Come to this hands-on lab to see how Oracle Management Cloud’s unified platform leverages machine learning and advanced analytics to detect advanced threats and ensures secure configuration in hybrid cloud environments.
abstract.72: GDPR compliance is critical to organizations. In this session learn how Oracle Cloud Access Security Broker Cloud Service’s data protection works to identify, classify, and secure information in your cloud services with out-of-the-box classifications, smart policies, and automated user entity behavioral analytics. Oracle CASB Cloud Service’s data protection easily identifies, alerts, and reverts changes that could expose your organization to risks. Join us to see how Oracle CASB Cloud Service’s data protection can help secure your data.
abstract.73: Are you migrating to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure? Come to this hands-on lab to see how Oracle Management Cloud simplifies your journey to Oracle PaaS by providing centralized management capabilities for your application and infrastructure deployed in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure and a hybrid IT environment.
abstract.74: As services become more agile and servers become more virtualized, it's more important than ever to better understand what's happening on your systems. The Oracle Solaris web dashboard and the underlying StatsStore are the one-stop shop to get detailed statistics and event data from the operating system and the applications. In this hands-on lab explore these new tools and get a detailed view of how to use them to better understand application performance, system utilization, and the current and historical compliance status of your system.
abstract.75:
PLEASE NOTE: YOU MUST BRING YOUR OWN DEVICE (BYOD) TO PARTICIPATE IN THE HANDS-ON LABS.
Bring your own device (phone, tablet, laptop) to experience what Oracle HCM Cloud can do for your organization. In this hands-on lab experience a modern consumer-like experience that you can deliver to your employees and managers to keep them engaged and productive while keeping the business moving. This self-paced lab focuses on core HR transactions and everyday employee, manager, and HR tasks. Discover how to derive maximum benefits from Oracle HCM Cloud. Oracle experts are on hand to answer questions and guide you through each lab ON YOUR OWN DEVICE. Join us to try it for yourself.

Lab Prerequisites:
You should ensure you have the ability to read QR codes on your device for ease of access.
abstract.76: MySQL 8.0 added support for common table expressions and window functions—the most required features. In this session learn about this implementation.
abstract.77: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Container Engine for Kubernetes is a fully managed, scalable, and highly available service that you can use to deploy your containerized applications to the cloud. You can also use it to reliably build, deploy, and manage cloud native applications. In this hands-on lab learn to containerize a Node.js web app, push it to Oracle Cloud registry, and deploy on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Container Engine for Kubernetes.
abstract.78: The Terraform Oracle Cloud Infrastructure provider delivers coverage for the entire Oracle Cloud Infrastructure API. In this hands-on lab learn to install and configure the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Terraform plugin and create a single compute instance using a sample Terraform script.
abstract.79: In this hands-on lab create JavaScript/HTML-based mobile and web applications in a visual way leveraging Oracle Visual Builder Cloud Service, a low-code development platform for the JavaScript generation. 35.bio: Roy Swonger has over three decades of experience in commercial software development. His 20+-year career at Oracle has included work on software process and quality improvement as well as a progression of management roles in technical documentation, software development tools, and core database technologies. Roy has managed the Database Upgrade & Utilities in the Server Technologies division for more than 10 years. In this capacity he is responsible for the development of database features such as the Data Pump, SQL*Loader, External Tables, and Transportable Tablespaces. In addition, Roy runs the global Upgrade Program for the database, coordinating worldwide efforts to make database upgrades faster, easier, and less risky for customers. Roy holds a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science from Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute, and a Master of Software Engineering from Carnegie Mellon University.

49.bio:
Oracle TimesTen Cloud Product Manager

I now live in the Cloud, but I used to integrate with MVS, AS/400, Tuxedo, CORBA, SOAP, sockets and REST.

I started using RDBMS with DEC Rdb/VMS and progressed to Oracle 5, 6, 7, 8i, 9i, 10g, 11g, 12c and 18c.  I fell in love with Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database as it is a really fast, simple and highly available RDBMS.

I have worked as a consultant, developer and product manager at Oracle over the years. My technical interests are making things go fast [OCI, ODBC and PLSQL] and getting things to work together. I am a fan of Golang and I am looking for a good PowerPoint LLVM compiler ...

I am now focused on Oracle TimesTen Scaleout.  TimesTen Scaleout is a shared nothing, scale out, In-Memory RDBMS based on TimesTen.

71.bio:
Tim Frazier is the Architect for the Security & Analytics Service for the Oracle Management Cloud. In this position, he is responsible for the overall architecture and technology selection for one of Oracle new services that implements big data and machine learning methods for addressing security concerns in the modern world.

Prior to joining Oracle, Tim was the Chief Information Officer for the NIF and Photon Science Principal Associate Directorate at the Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory. In this position, he was responsible for defining the vision and leading the teams that design, implement and support of the computing infrastructure that support the operational and experimental requirements of NIF’s complex experimental Programs

Prior to joining LLNL in 2007, he was the founder and Chief Technical Officer of Sunflower Systems, a private sector software firm that provides asset management software to Federal Government agencies, contractors and Public Sector organizations. Tim is a graduate of the University of Virginia with a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science and a Bachelor’s Degree in Applied Mathematics.
 
Tim has won several awards including Oracle’s Enterprise Architect of the Year, Consultant of the Quarter and is a recognized authority in the areas of scientific data archives, software analysis frameworks, large-scale database design & systems architecture. He is a member of the Tau Beta Pi Engineering honor society and the Association for Computing Machinery.

79.bio: Michael Ferrante is a Product Manager on Oracle's Application Development Tools team, working with Oracle Forms and Visual Builder Cloud Service.  Joining Oracle in 1999, Michael has spent nearly two decades in various roles associated with Oracle Forms and related Fusion Middleware technologies.  From Support Engineer to Global Technical Lead (GTL) to Product Manager and numerous roles in between, Michael has remained closely connected to Oracle's Middleware products, but none closer than Oracle Forms.  Working side-by-side with Oracle’s customers and Oracle’s Development and many Support teams, Michael helps to bring the latest innovations to future versions of Oracle Forms and other Application Development technologies.  As the industry accelerates on its path to Cloud, Michael is now welcoming VBCS, DevCS, and other Cloud technologies into his portfolio.
